meanings.definition: A botanical term referring to a type of inflorescence with two opposite cymes.
meanings.sent1: The garden displayed beautiful dichasia flowers with pairs of cymes.
meanings.sent2: The dichasia inflorescence of the plant had two distinct cymes on each side.
meanings.sent3: The dichasia blooms seemed to dance together in perfect harmony.
meanings.sent4: Her bouquet was a dichasia of colors, blending seamlessly like a painting.
meanings.sent5: The dichasia arrangement in the vase brought a burst of color to the room.

meanings.definition: A term used in rhetoric to describe a figure of speech involving a series of two contrasting ideas.
meanings.sent1: The author's use of dichasia in the speech highlighted the opposing viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: The dichasia in the debate emphasized the stark differences between the arguments.
meanings.sent3: The dichasia in the presentation added a touch of drama to the discussion.
meanings.sent4: His writing was a dichasia of light and dark, creating a vivid contrast.
meanings.sent5: The dichasia of opinions in the room made it hard to reach a consensus.
